title: Raiffeisen bank - vstup na účet
content:
Dobrý den,

potřeboval bych poradit s nastavením prohlížeče Firefox 110.0 (64 bitů). Nedaří se mi přihlásit do internetového bankovnictví Raiffeisen bank. Úvodní webová stránka https://www.rb.cz/ se zobrazí správně. Dál po kliknutí na odkaz "Vstup na účet" do zabezpečené zóny a po zadání klientského čísla se zobrazí pouze prázdná stránka bez možnosti dalšího kroku potvrzení vstupu a otevření zabezpezpečené stránky internetového bankovnictví. Zřejmě dochází ke kolizi nějakého protokolu se zabezpečením. Podobná situace nastává při přihlášení na webovky https://wd3.myworkday.com

děkuji za odpověď

S pozdravem

Luděk Hřeblo
creator: hreblo.ludek

title: Use of the Danish official authorization "MitID"
content:
In Denmark we have a common Authorization system, called MitID. It has worked fine in Firefox until the last update. But no longer. MitID works fine in Safari, Edge and Chrome. But no longer in Firefox.

Since MitID is use for banking and financial services, libraries and all communication with any public service, it is crucial for any Danish user.

So unless you will say goodbye to all Danish users - including mee (after many years), you had better correct your bug.

Kind Regards
creator: jens65

title: Firefox Keeps signing me out of websites
content:
Hello,

Firefox keeps signing me out of online websites like gmail, Netflix, etc. Basically anything with a password. I have been using Firefox for years and never had this as an issue. It is on my iMac which never leaves home so I don't have to worry about anyone but me accessing these websites. The issue is especially with Gmail because I have been late to online meetings because I am finding myself signed out. This is very frustrating and I need this resolved ASAP otherwise I am going to have to use a different browser. I really like Firefox so I prefer not to.

Please advise how to fix this, I would really appreciate a quick response on this one.

Thank you, ~Ray

title: cannot login to medadvisor application
content: I use the med advisor website to order medications. I have done this for many years. I started using Firefox last year and at first it worked fine. At one point, I think it was after an update, I could no longer Login to their site. I could bring up the Login page but it refused to let me enter my details, just the spinning circle. Now I can still get to their home page but it wont even load their login page. I can still use other browsers to login, so I am not inconvenienced. Still I am wondering why this is the case. I have no problems with Login to any other website, just this one.
creator: mhayward9

title: Extension icons missing after reinstallation
content:
I'm on Windows 11 and on the latest version of Firefox.

I had to uninstall Firefox (it was crashing). I then reinstalled Firefox, then synced. Now the icons for all my extensions are missing. They don't show up when I try to customize my toolbar. The native icons are visible in the customize toolbar tab.

I've done my due diligence and googled. I've uninstalled, then deleted the Mozilla folders under AppData. I've deleted the Mozilla entries in my registry.

I used Bulk Crap Uninstaller and nuked everything it could find.

After using BC Uninstaller, Firefox finally stopped telling me that it would re-install Firefox. That is, it appeared to be convinced to perform a completely new installation.

But nothing helps. I re-install, I sync, and then my icons are missing again.

What do I do? I'm frustrated enough to give up on Firefox.
creator: vikramchandra

As pesquisas são na barra de endereço), tem sites preferidos, mas eu não consigo colocar uma foto de tele de fundo igual eu consigo no Chrome e no Brave. Será que alguém pode me ajudar?

title: Insecure Passive Content Netflix Canada-Can't resolve -Why?
content:
For over 6 weeks, and only on Netflix Canada, we (family members) have been getting the padlock with a triangle in the address bar only after I log into Netflix. This occurs on any and all of our 4 computers using all of the 3 different internet providers, one of which is the largest Internet provider in Canada, BELL including also the their BELL Mobility Network. I appreciate that as you can see we're using older operating systems, but Firefox reports our version 110 is up to date. Our adult children have much newer computers and later if not the latest Mac OS, and are attempting to access Netflix from other internet providers elsewhere in the province of Ontario. One of them is using the next largest internet provider in Canada, or at least the province, ROGERS. She too is still having this problem. I've been through the mill with Netflix's support people and they blame you guys and our internet providers. I cannot resolve the issue, and for that reason we have ceased using Netflix because of the implicit security vulnerability attached.

What can I do about this? -Peter
creator: peter683

title: Excessive apparmor log entries on Ubuntu platform
content:
OS version: Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS (jammy), 64-bit (amd64, x86_64). Firefox version: 110.0 (64-bit) (NOTE: the issue was noticed with version 109.0, too)

Firefox package was installed on Ubuntu through 'APT', using the Mozilla Team repository (https://ppa.launchpadcontent.net/mozillateam/ppa/ubuntu/). It caught my attention that an excessive amount of Firefox related 'DENIED' AppArmor log messages is generated during the browser activity.

According to messages, Firefox is occasionally denied read access to '/sys/devices/' area and read/write access to 'oom_score_adj' target in '/proc/'. Could somebody clarify why would that access be required for regular browser operations? I'm a bit puzzled as I haven't noticed anything similar with the older Ubuntu and Firefox versions. A complete suppression of those messages is also an option as long as there's no negative impact on application's performance.

I already posted this question to Ubuntu forum but seems like nobody there could provide an explanation. I'd appreciate any input or hint.

Following is the sample of referred log messages:

---SNIP--- [Fri Feb 24 19:14:50 2023] audit: type=1400 audit(1674000890.813:39): apparmor="DENIED" operation="capable" profile="firefox" pid=2231 comm="firefox" capability=21 capname="sys_admin"

[Fri Feb 24 19:14:50 2023] audit: type=1400 audit(1674000890.877:40): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" profile="firefox" name="/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:02.0/revision" pid=2235 comm="firefox" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=1000 ouid=0

[Fri Feb 24 19:14:50 2023] audit: type=1400 audit(1674000890.877:41): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" profile="firefox" name="/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:02.0/config" pid=2235 comm="firefox" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=1000 ouid=0

[Fri Feb 24 19:14:50 2023] audit: type=1400 audit(1674000890.877:42): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" profile="firefox" name="/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:02.0/revision" pid=2235 comm="firefox" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=1000 ouid=0

[Fri Feb 24 19:14:50 2023] audit: type=1400 audit(1674000890.877:43): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" profile="firefox" name="/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:02.0/config" pid=2235 comm="firefox" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=1000 ouid=0

[Fri Feb 24 19:14:50 2023] audit: type=1400 audit(1674000890.885:44): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" profile="firefox" name="/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:02.0/revision" pid=2235 comm="firefox" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=1000 ouid=0
